Button/Tooltip/11ABioEngineer=MOS: 11A (Infantry) Role: Bio Engineer<n/>The infantry rifleman is a versatile soldier on the battlefield. His duties range from simple security to basic reconnaissance. Abilities:<n/>-Soldier Skills<n/>-Marksmanship<n/>-Frag Grenade<n/>-Rifleman Skills
Button/Tooltip/11APlatoonLeader=MOS: 11A (Infantry) Role: Platoon Leader<n/>Platoon leaders are typically lieutenants. Their job is to make tactical decisions and coordinate their platoon. They range from OCS graduates to former NCOs, and typically have a lot of "theoretical" knowledge, whereas a platoon sergeant would have more wisdom and experience. <n/>Abilities:<n/>-Soldier Skills<n/>-Marksmansip<n/>-Leadership Skills<n/>-Leadership<n/>-Training
Button/Tooltip/11BJavelinGunner=MOS: 11B (Infantry) Role: Javelin Gunner<n/>Javelin Gunners are designated within the platoon and have recieved special training with the Javelin. <n/>Abilities:<n/>-Soldier Skills<n/>-Javelin Skills<n/>-AT Rocket<n/>-HE Rocket
Button/Tooltip/11BSquadDesignatedMarksman=MOS 11B (Infantry) Role: Squad Designated Marksman<n/>SDMs are hand picked soldiers with excellent performance in marksmanship. They are usually issued special optics or long-range rifles for overwatch.<n/>Abilities:<n/>-Soldier Skills<n/>-Marksmanship<n/>-Rapid Fire<n/>-Marksman Skills<n/>-Monomolecular Wire
Button/Tooltip/12BCombatEngineer=MOS: 12B (Combat Engineer)<n/>Combat Engineers recieve a year-long special training for constructing battlefield essential infrastructure (bridges, ramps, etc.), obstacle creation and placement, and demolitions in an innovative field environment. <n/>Abilities:<n/>-Soldier Skills<n/>-Cluster Rockets<n/>-Security<n/>-Engineering Skills
Button/Tooltip/12BRACombatEngineer=MOS: 12B (Combat Engineer)<n/>Combat Engineers recieve a year-long special training for constructing battlefield essential infrastructure (bridges, ramps, etc.), obstacle creation and placement, and demolitions in an innovative field environment. Abilities:<n/>-Soldier Skills<n/>-Cluster Rockets<n/>-Security<n/>-Engineering Skills
Button/Tooltip/13FFireSupportSpecialist=MOS: 13F (Fire Support Specialist)<n/>Fire Support Specialists recieve specialized training in AIT about calling for fire. Later, they learn about other, specialized forms of Indirect Fire (IDF), Orbital Fire Support (OFS) and air support. <n/>Abilities:<n/>-Soldier Skills<n/>-Call for Fire<n/>-Joint Fires Observer<n/>-Indirect Fire Support
Button/Tooltip/18BCommando=MOS 18B (Commando) Role: Elite Rifleman<n/>Commandoes are deployed when missions absolutely need to be finished by any means possible. They are skilled with their rifle and explosives.<n/>Abilities:<n/>-Soldier Skills<n/>-Marksmanship<n/>-Survival Skills<n/>-Explosives Expert<n/>-Prototype Weaponry

Button/Tooltip/Readiness=The javelin gunner is trained for rapid response, increasing energy by 50.
Button/Tooltip/Readme1=Welcome to Undead Assault Chronicles.<n/><n/>This game will come as a challenge and due to the age of the community, a majority of the runs will be Survival Mode. However don't let that spoil the experience of the game for you. It's highly suggested to run Campaign Recruit mode if its your first time so you can get your bearings for the game in a relatively relaxed mode (It can easily be run Solo). Don't forget to set your <c val="008000">Command Card </c>on the Rank selection screen to <c val="008000">Custom</c> for an easier time handling your hotkeys.<n/><n/><c val="800000">Explosives Hurt allies</c>, anything that explodes will harm your friends. Avoid using things like <c val="800000">Frag Grenades</c> or <c val="800000">MRLs</c> near your allies. You wouldn't want to be nuked, so they wouldn't either.
Button/Tooltip/Readme2=<c val="008000">Basics!</c><n/><n/>Everyone uses<c val="008000"> Magazines</c>, They'll work for anything from Flamethrowers to Machine Guns. Be sure to always keep some handy and try not to ready over <c val="008000">15 </c>at a time. Otherwise you become encumbered and lose movement speed.<n/><n/><c val="008000">Weapon Jams: </c> Most Classes in game will have a change for their weapon to Jam, preventing you from shooting with your weapon. Unjam your gun by pressing <c val="008000">Key Series Z -> A</c>. It is also possible to fix Weapon Jams by reloading.<n/><n/><c val="008000">Sprinting:</c> The Hotkey is either<c val="008000"> T</c> (For Custom Command Card), Sprinting is a rechargable buff and allows you to quickly move away from zombies or reach a point on the map. Its best to use as needed and preserve your sprint until necessary. Veteran players will often turn this on and off to maximize their speeds.<n/><n/><c val="008000">Jumping:</c> They Hotkey is either<c val="008000"> Q</c> (For Custom Command Card) Jumping allows you to evade and move down cliff levels without needing to navigate around. Try not to jump down cliffs greater than 2 height levels, or you'll sustain an injury.
Button/Tooltip/Readme3=<c val="008000">Basics Continued!</c><n/><n/><c val="008000">Injuries: </c>Most injuries will be curable by the item named "<c val="008000">Quik Clot</c>". <c val="008000">First Aid Kits</c> and <c val="008000">Self Aid</c> earned through soldier skills will fix Ailments listed as <c val="FFFF00">Minor</c>.<c val="008000"> Combat Medics</c> who have maxed out their <c val="008000">First Aid Skill</c> set will be able to fix all <c val="800000">Ailments that aren't environmentally based</c>. Try to stay healthy and avoid coming into contact with zombies to minimize the need to use items.<n/><n/><c val="008000">Death:</c> Unless there are no <c val="008000">Combat Medics</c> or the Game Modifier "<c val="800000">1 Life</c>" is active, you can be saved.<c val="008000"> Combat Medics</c> have the ability to <c val="008000">Revive</c> allies. There is a lengthy cooldown for using the ability, so try to keep their load light.

DocInfo/HowToPlayAdvanced01=If all the combat medics are dead, there are respawns and reinforcements at certain points in the game.
DocInfo/HowToPlayAdvanced02=Use the buttons in the bottom of the screen near the unit portrait. Very useful ones are "tl" which pings your team and "sa" to save.

DocInfo/PatchNote1295=SI changes:
DocInfo/PatchNote1296= 
DocInfo/PatchNote1297=Reactive Armor: 
DocInfo/PatchNote1298=(Old) Have a 33% chance to reduce damage by 40% if damage taken is 150 or more.
DocInfo/PatchNote1299=(New) Have a 40% chance to reduce damage by 45% if damage taken is 125 or more. 
DocInfo/PatchNote1300=
DocInfo/PatchNote1301=Bloodlust
DocInfo/PatchNote1302=(Old) Kills increase damage dealt by 1.5% for 8 seconds. Buff stacks up to 30% bonus damage.
DocInfo/PatchNote1303=(New) Kills increase both ranged and spell damage dealt by 1.5% for 20 seconds. Buff stacks up to 30% bonus damage. 
DocInfo/PatchNote1304=
DocInfo/PatchNote1305=PureBlood:
DocInfo/PatchNote1306=(Old) Prevents you from getting infected bite, parasitic infection, and unidentified infection.

DocInfo/PatchNote988=-Failing generator mission no longer creates a 2x penalty spawn
DocInfo/PatchNote989=-Rescuing soldiers/police officers missions spawn invunerable for a short duration

DocInfo/PatchNote991=-Destructible rocks can no longer be destroyed by strafe ability

DocInfo/PatchNote993=-Generators life bar removed
DocInfo/PatchNote994=-Night time reduces sight & weapon range if Nods aren't enabled
DocInfo/PatchNote995=-Camo/Decal buttons color when selected
DocInfo/PatchNote996=-AWT will focus its attack on a unit that is laser designated. Unit must be in range
